column4: <eL_pSycHo> sorry i got disconnected .. did you find any solution to my problem
try this to generate the xorg.conf    sudo Xorg -configure
what graphics card do you have and how did you install those drivers in 9.04???
now you need to copy your new xorg over to the x11 dir... like this..  sudo cp /root/xorg.conf.new /etc/X11/xorg.conf
but your mouse might not work..... let me see... i dont remember the defaults for mice... maybe someone knows..? ill check in the mean time.
well.. you could try to start your session now.. but your mouse might not work...  try to see if everything else is and then we'll tackle that.
what video card do you have? how did you install its drivers while on 9.04?
please paste the contents of your xorg.conf here http://paste.ubuntu.com
mipz0r: you could copy your xorg.conf to a flash drive maybe?
type mount on the terminal is it listed there? it also tells you where it is mounted.
i think thats wrong... shouldnt he be doing it in the mount point and no the device???
mount points are usually under the media folder.
what is the mount point for your flash drive???
then your mount point for that device is /media/Storage
how is it going? how is your problem?
yes.. just copy them from the terminal like you did the xorg.conf file.... remember?
if you have a flash drive big enough for all your stuff then you can use the terminal to copy all your work to it.. or your whole home folder if you have enough space....
